{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's symptoms such as primary amenorrhea, short stature, webbed neck, and widely spaced nipples are characteristic of Turner syndrome. This condition is also associated with streak ovaries and elevated FSH levels due to ovarian failure. The weak pulses in the lower extremities could be due to coarctation of the aorta, a common cardiovascular abnormality in Turner syndrome. The most common karyotype in Turner syndrome is 45XO, which means there is a single X chromosome and no second sex chromosome.", "answer_choice": "A. 45XO"}
